::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module2_mcq_q40')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">
A stock is priced at $100 at the beginning of the year.  
At the end of the year, the stock price rises to $108 and the firm pays a dividend of $2. What is the stock’s total realized return?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q40" value="A"> A. 8.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q40" value="B"> B. 9.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q40" value="C"> C. 10.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q40" value="D"> D. 10.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q40" value="E"> E. 11.0%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q40" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: D. The return is \((2 + 108)/100 - 1 = 0.10 = 10\%\).  
This return combines the **dividend yield** (2/100 = 2%) and the **capital gain rate** (8/100 = 8%).
</div>
:::
